Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cm38 (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BWQ, unclassified)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Purified from a 2-step chromatographic method. Warning: only the N-terminal 19 amino acids are reported based on Edman degradation. 38.5% SIMILAR TOBrevinin-2-related peptideActivity: Active against K. pneumoniae (MIC 64 uM). Also active in neurons.
Literature Information.Author: Duenas-Cuellar RA, Kushmerick C, Naves LA, Batista IF, Guerrero-Vargas JA, Pires OR Jr, Fontes W, Castro MS. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Cm38: A New Antimicrobial Peptide Active Against Klebsiella pneumoniae is Homologous to Cn11
